com.srch2.android.http.service

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.Query

  • public final class Query
extends Object
    Formulation of an advanced search. Users of the SRCH2 Android SDK can invoke this class to create advanced searches that enable operations above and beyond the basic default search performed.

      • Query

        public Query(com.srch2.android.http.service.Term term)
        Creates a query from a SearchableTerm or SearchableTerm.CompositeTerm;
        Parameters:

      • Query

        public Query(String term1,
     String term2,
     int distance)
        Creates a query doing a proximity search. The SRCH2 search server supports finding words that are within a specified proximity. To use this feature, enablePositionIndex flag in the configuration should be set to true.

        For example, the following query searches for records with the keywords "saving" and "ryan" within 1 word 

         Query("saving", "ryan", 1)


        (that is, either zero or one word separates them) of each other in a document.

        Note that a proximity search does not support edit-distance-based fuzzy match, i.e., we do not allow typos in the keywords in the quotes.

        This method will throw exceptions if the term arguments passed have values that are null or have a length less than one; or if the value of distance is less than one.

    • Method Detail

      • filterByFieldEqualsTo

        public Query filterByFieldEqualsTo(String fieldName,
                          String equalToValue)
        Creates a query doing a filtered search. To initialize this kind of query, specify a filter that will restrict the set of records returned by using the conditionality of fields[fieldName].value == equalToValue.

        This method will throw exceptions if the term arguments passed have values that are null or have a length less than one; or if the value of distance is less than one.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the specific field to evaluate
        equalToValue - the value to equate the fieldName to

      • filterByFieldStartsFrom

        public Query filterByFieldStartsFrom(String fieldName,
                            String startValue)
        It allows us to match records whose field value starts from a specified lower bound.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the specific field.
        startValue - the startValue (inclusive).
        Returns:
        this

      • setFilterRelationAND

        public Query setFilterRelationAND()
        Note: the engine supports only one kind of boolean operator (OR or AND) between all the filter terms. This function is set to connect all the filters using AND operator
        Returns:
        this

      • setFilterRelationOR

        public Query setFilterRelationOR()
        Note: the engine supports only one kind of boolean operator (OR or AND) between all the filter terms. This function is set to connect all the filters using OR operator
        Returns:
        this

      • sortOnFields

        public Query sortOnFields(String field1,
                 String... restFields)
        The engine's default behavior is to sort the results using a descending order by the overall score of each record. The user can specify sorting by other fields.

        Note the SearchType will be automatically set to getAll method

        Parameters:
        field1 - the first field
        restFields - the rest of the fields
        Returns:
        this

      • orderByAscending

        public Query orderByAscending()
        It specifies the order in which the result set should be sorted. This order is valid for all the fields specified in the sort parameter.
        Returns:
        this

      • orderByDescending

        public Query orderByDescending()
        It specifies the order in which the result set should be sorted. Engine by default uses "desc" (descending) order. This order is valid for all the fields specified in the sort parameter.
        Returns:
        this

      • pagingStartFrom

        public Query pagingStartFrom(int startOffset)
        It is the offset in the complete result set of the query, where the set of returned records should begin. The default value is 0
        Parameters:
        startOffset - specify the start offset of the result
        Returns:
        this

      • pagingSize

        public Query pagingSize(int sizePerPage)
        It indicates the number of records to return from the complete result set.
        Parameters:
        sizePerPage - specify how many result within one search response
        Returns:
        this
